body_html:
@asimonov There have not been any fixes that went in for cuda_configure since 4c49dbe, which went in 10 days ago and should be related to this issue.

All: If you are experiencing the '@local_config_cuda//crosstool': BUILD file not found issue, the most likely cause of the problem is that cuda_configure is being re-run during bazel build and is re-configuring with GPU support disabled.

  1. Are you modifying any files under third_party/gpus between running ./configure and bazel build? If so, then the reason why you are experiencing the error is because Bazel is re-fetching as explained here. Please explain why you need to do so, and we'll see if we can come up with a solution to avoid that.
  2. If not, please follow the instructions here so that we can have more state in order to debug why the re-fetch is happening.

body:
@asimonov There have not been any fixes that went in for `cuda_configure` since 4c49dbebef05442c7e72d6129a30574fcd13f0e1, which went in 10 days ago and should be related to this issue.

All: If you are experiencing the `'@local_config_cuda//crosstool': BUILD file not found` issue, the most likely cause of the problem is that `cuda_configure` is being re-run during `bazel build` and is re-configuring with GPU support disabled.
1. **Are you modifying any files under `third_party/gpus` between running `./configure` and `bazel build`?** If so, then the reason why you are experiencing the error is because Bazel is re-fetching as explained [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/4105#issuecomment-245110873). Please explain why you need to do so, and we'll see if we can come up with a solution to avoid that.
2. **If not, please follow the instructions [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/4105#issuecomment-244868298)** so that we can have more state in order to debug why the re-fetch is happening.
